Submodules¶

mfm.common module¶

common.py

Common data for all scripts in the SuRF-toolbox. In the common library all kinds of constants are defined. For instance colors in plots but also constants as the Avogadros number.

mfm.common.CHARGE_DICT = {'ARG': 1.0, 'ASP': -1.0, 'CTERM': -1.0, 'CYS': -1.0, 'GLU': -1.0, 'HIS': 1.0, 'LYS': 1.0, 'NTERM': 1.0, 'TYR': -1.0}¶

Default charges of amino acids

mfm.common.MAX_BONDS = {'C': 4, 'H': 1, 'N': 4, 'O': 3, 'P': 5}¶

Dictionary of maximum number of bonds per atom type

mfm.common.MW_DICT = {'ACE': 43.3, 'ALA': 89.09, 'ARG': 174.2, 'ASN': 132.12, 'ASP': 133.1, 'ASX': 132.61, 'CYS': 121.15, 'GLN': 146.15, 'GLU': 147.13, 'GLX': 146.64, 'GLY': 75.07, 'HIS': 155.16, 'ILE': 131.17, 'IVA': 85.12, 'LEU': 131.17, 'LYS': 146.19, 'MET': 149.21, 'PHE': 165.19, 'PRO': 115.13, 'SER': 105.09, 'STA': 157.15, 'THR': 119.12, 'TRP': 204.23, 'TYR': 181.19, 'VAL': 117.15}¶

Dictionary of amino acid molecular weights. The the molecular weight of water should be subtracted for each peptide bond to calculate a protein molecular weight.

mfm.common.MW_H2O = 18.0¶

Molecular weight of water

mfm.common.PKA_DICT = {'ARG': 12.0, 'ASP': 4.0, 'CTERM': 3.1, 'CYS': 8.5, 'GLU': 4.4, 'HIS': 6.5, 'LYS': 10.4, 'NTERM': 8.0, 'TYR': 10.0}¶

Dictionary of pKa values and un-protonated charge state.

mfm.common.TITR_ATOM = {'ARG': 'CZ ', 'ASP': 'CG ', 'GLU': 'CD ', 'HIS': 'NE2', 'LYS': 'NZ ', 'TYR': 'OH '}¶

Atom on which to place charge in amino-acid

mfm.common.TITR_ATOM_COARSE = {'ARG': 'CB', 'ASP': 'CB', 'CYS': 'CB', 'GLU': 'CB', 'HIS': 'CB', 'LYS': 'CB', 'TYR': 'CB'}¶

Atom on which to place charge in amino-acid (Coarse grained default position C-Beta)

mfm.common.quencher_names = dict_keys(['TRP', 'MET', 'TYR', 'HIS', 'PRO'])¶

Definition of quenching amino-acids and quenching atoms of quencher

property dx¶

The derivative of the x-axis

from_dict(self, v: 'dict')[source]¶
property fwhm¶
Return type

float

normalize(self, mode: 'str' = 'max', curve: 'mfm.curve.Curve' = None, inplace: 'bool' = True) → 'float'[source]¶

Calculates a scaling parameter for the Curve object and (optionally) scales the Curve object.

Parameters

  • mode (str) – either ‘max’ to normalize the maximum to one, or ‘sum’ to normalize to sum to one

  • curve (Optional[Curve]) –

  • inplace (bool) – if True the Curve object is modified in place. Otherwise, only the scaling parameter

is returned :rtype: float :return: the parameter that scales the Curve object

mfm.parameter module¶

class mfm.parameter.Parameter(value=1.0, link=None, lb=-inf, ub=inf, bounds_on=False, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: mfm.base.Base

property bounds¶

A tuple containing the values for the lower (first value) and the upper (second value) of the bound.

Return type

Tuple[float, float]

Return type

property is_linked¶
Return type

bool

property link¶
to_dict(self) → 'dict'[source]¶
Return type

dict

property value¶

The value of the parameter.

This value of the parameter considers links and bounds, i.e., if a parameter is linked to another parameter the value of the linked parameter is returned. First, links are considered, then bounds are considered.

Return type

float

Returns
